title: Database Design Scenario
description: Make decisions in a database design scenario

questions.description: You're designing a database for an e-commerce platform. You need to store product information and customer orders. What's the best approach?
options: Separate tables: Products, Orders, OrderItems with proper relationships
questions.correctChoice: Separate tables: Products, Orders, OrderItems with proper relationships
questions.explanation: Normalized database design with proper relationships ensures data integrity and avoids redundancy.

questions.description: A query is running slowly on a table with millions of records. What should you do first?
options: Create an index on the columns used in WHERE clause
questions.correctChoice: Create an index on the columns used in WHERE clause
questions.explanation: Indexes significantly speed up queries by allowing faster data retrieval without scanning entire tables.

questions.description: You need to ensure that once an order is placed, inventory is automatically updated. What database feature should you use?
questions.explanation: Triggers automatically execute actions when specific events occur, perfect for maintaining data consistency.

questions.description: Multiple users are trying to update the same record simultaneously. What mechanism prevents conflicts?
questions.explanation: Transactions with proper locking mechanisms ensure ACID properties and prevent concurrent update conflicts.
